text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the Greek Cypriot press on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these reports and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Cyprus wants the European Union to give it a chance to prove it wants a solution to the political issue.
- Justice minister wants more leniency to reduce prisons overcrowding.
- The dollar reaches a 31-month high against the Cyprus pound.
- Cyprus stock exchange index falls to a record low.
- The tourism industry braces itself for a difficult year ahead.
- A split looms in right-wing Democratic Rally, with some members looking for a presidential candidate other than President Glafcos Clerides.
- Germany puts up obstacles to Cyprus's accession to the European Union.

- Centre-right Diko and right-wing Disy agree to restore trust in their government partnership, but the continuing presence of Justice Minister Alecos Evangelou in the cabinet is still a cause of concern for Diko.
- Eu countries will accelerate efforts to solve the Cyprus problem before entry negotiations start.
- Diko MP Marios Matsakis re-appears after two days in the Akamas protesting against British military exercises.
